statements: UPDATE StudentProgressReports SET class_grade=10, progress_report='Good progress' WHERE student_id=123
UPDATE StudentProgressReports SET teacher_name='Mr. Johnson', subject='Mathematics' WHERE student_name='Alice'
UPDATE StudentProgressReports SET progress_report = 'Good progress in Math' WHERE student_id = 101
UPDATE StudentProgressReports SET teacher_name = 'Ms. Smith', subject = 'Science', class_grade = 8 WHERE student_name = 'Alice'
UPDATE StudentProgressReports SET grade = 'A' WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE ParentAccess SET student_id = 2 WHERE parent_id = 1;
UPDATE StudentProgressReports SET grade='A' WHERE student_id=12345;
UPDATE ParentAccess SET parent_name='John Doe', student_id=12345 WHERE parent_id=1;
UPDATE Students SET grade_level = 12 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE Courses SET teacher = 'Mrs. Smith' WHERE course_id = 5;
UPDATE Students SET student_name = 'Alice', grade_level = 10 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE ProgressReports SET grade = 85.5, report_date = '2022-05-15' WHERE report_id = 101;
UPDATE progress_reports SET progress = 80, grade = 'A' WHERE student_id = 101
UPDATE students SET age = 20, parent_email = 'parent@example.com' WHERE student_id = 202
UPDATE progress_reports SET progress = 0.75, grade = 'A-' WHERE student_id = 123 AND course_id = 456;
UPDATE students SET age = 20, parent_email = 'newparent@example.com' WHERE student_id = 789;
UPDATE Student SET grade_level = 11 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE Course SET credit_hours = 4 WHERE course_id = 3;
UPDATE Student SET age = 19, grade_level = 11 WHERE student_id = 3;
UPDATE Enrollment SET enrollment_date = '2022-05-15' WHERE enrollment_id = 7;
